p: The susceptibility of the B/2017 and B/2017-MA strains to oseltamivir (Hoffmann-La Roche, Basel, Switzerland) was evaluated by published NA inhibition assays [ 24, 25]. Briefly, viruses were standardized to a NA activity level 10-fold higher than that of the background, as measured by the production of fluorescent product from methylumbelliferyl-N-acetylneuraminic acid (MUNANA) substrate (Sigma-Aldrich, Darmstadt, Germany). Drug susceptibility profiles were determined by the extent of NA inhibition (NAI) after incubation with 3-fold serial dilutions of NAIs. The 50% inhibitory concentrations (IC 50) were determined from the dose-response curve.
